meanings.definition: Stevedores: People employed to load and unload cargo from ships.
meanings.sent1: The stevedores worked hard to unload the heavy crates from the ship.
meanings.sent2: The stevedores at the port efficiently loaded the cargo onto the vessel.
meanings.sent3: The stevedores joked about having to lift all the boxes onto the dock.
meanings.sent4: Watching the stevedores in action was like witnessing a well-coordinated dance.
meanings.sent5: The image of the stevedores sweating under the sun stayed with me.

meanings.definition: Stevedores: The act of loading and unloading cargo from ships.
meanings.sent1: The stevedores required strong muscles to perform their duties on the docks.
meanings.sent2: Efficiency is crucial in the stevedores' work of moving goods from ship to shore.
meanings.sent3: The stevedores' job seemed like a never-ending game of moving boxes around.
meanings.sent4: The precision of the stevedores' movements was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the stevedores shouting instructions echoed across the harbor.
